description.hltext_display: Welkom-Bultfontein road closed
description.content:
The R701 between Welkom and Bultfontein in the Free State was closed on Wednesday due to rain damage to a bridge, the province's roads department said.
Motorists travelling between Welkom and Bultfontein were advised to use the Odendaalsrus - Wesselsbron - Bultfontein route. Motorists travelling to Bloemfontein can use the R30 Rev Mahabane route via Theunissen and Brandfort but that route is still under construction so motorists should be cautious and vigilant, the roads department said. - Sapa

description.hltext_display: مجلس الشيوخ يفتح الطريق للتصديق على معاهدة ستارت
description.author: admin
description.content: فتح مجلس الشيوخ الاميركي الثلاثاء الطريق للتصديق على معاهدة الحد من السلاح النووي (ستارت) بموافقته على انهاء المناقشات بتصويت اختباري حصلت فيه المعاهدة على اغلبية 67 صوتا من مائة. /واقر اعضاء المجلس ب67 صوتا مقابل 28 المذكرة التي تتيح انهاء المناقشات بعد سبعة ايام كاملة من التراشقات المكثفة امام المجلس.وتامل الاغلبية الديموقراطية، متشجعة بنتيجة هذا التصويت، اجراء تصويت للتصديق النهائي على المعاهدة في الساعات المقبلة اي اعتبارا من مساء الثلاثاء او الاربعاء.واعتبر السناتور الديموقراطي جون كيري رئيس لجنة الشؤون الخارجية الذي قاد المناقشات داخل مجلس الشيوخ حول المصادقة على ستارت، في بيان بث بعد التصويت "نحن على وشك كتابة الفصل المقبل في تاريخ مكافحة تهديد الاسلحة النووية".ويسيطر الديموقراطيون حاليا على 58 مقعدا من مائة في مجلس الشيوخ الاميركي. ومن ثم ينقصهم اصوات تسعة جمهوريين للتوصل الى الاصوات ال67 اللازمة للتصديق اي ثلثي المجلس.وبعد هذا التصويت الاول يبدو ان التصديق اصبح محسوما. وبالفعل، فان ما مجموعه 11 سناتورا جمهوريا صوتوا لصحالح المصادقة على المعاهدة.وتعارض روسيا اي تعديل في المعاهدة، كما اعلن الاثنين وزير الخارجية سيرغي لافروف. ولن يصدق البرلمان الروسي على المعاهدة الا بعد تصديق مجلس الشيوخ الاميركي.وكان اعضاء مجلس الشيوخ الاميركي يعتزمون الثلاثاء تعديل "قرار المصادقة" وهو وثيقة داخلية في مجلس الشيوخ بهدف الرد على هواجس الجمهوريين حول مصير نظام الدفاع الاميركي المضاد للصواريخ. وان مثل هذا العمل لن يكون له تاثير على المعاهدة بحد ذاتها بما انه لن يلزم سوى الاميركيين.

description.hltext_display: Saudi King leaves hospital
description.author: Paul Handley
description.content:
Riyadh - Saudi King Abdullah has left a New York hospital to convalesce, the royal court announced on Wednesday, one month after his departure for back surgery sparked speculation about the future of the kingdom's leadership.
King Abdullah left the hospital on Tuesday evening ?for his New York residence for a period of convalescence and physiotherapy,? the court said in a statement carried by the official SPA news agency.
Saudi television showed Abdullah, about 86 years old, together with Health Minister Abdullah al-Rabeeah, walking with difficulty and smiling at hospital staff.
There was no mention of when the king would return to Saudi Arabia.
As head of a government led by several princes in their 70s and 80s, many also suffering chronic health problems, Abdullah's travelling to the United States for treatment sparked quiet speculation about the future of the leadership in many Saudi circles.
He flew to New York on November 22 and was operated on two days later at New York Presbyterian Hospital for a debilitating herniated disc complicated by a haematoma that put pressure on his spine.
That operation was declared a success. On December 4 he underwent surgery a second time to repair several vertebrae, a procedure that the court said had been planned by his doctors.
The second operation too was declared a success but until Wednesday no official news of his condition had been released.
US Vice-President Joe Biden paid a visit to the hospital and met with Abdullah's family on December 15, the White House said, but apparently did not meet the king himself.
Abdullah's advanced age combined with his back hernia raised concerns about the future of the world's biggest oil exporter, which has been ruled by the Al-Saud family since 1932.
The crown prince, Abdullah's half brother Prince Sultan bin Abdul Aziz, who has been defence minister since 1962, is also in his mid-80s and has been slowed by what is believed to be cancer.
Little seen for the past two years, Sultan returned from Morocco on November 21 to assume control of the royal government in Abdullah's absence.
Prince Nayef bin Abdul Aziz, presumed second-in-line for the throne and interior minister for the past 35 years, is much more active but at 76 is believed to have his own health challenges.
The other top royals, including Prince Saud al-Faisal, foreign minister since 1975, and the Riyadh governor for 48 years, Prince Salman bin Abdul Aziz, 71, have also all spent substantial time abroad in the past year being treated for chronic ailments.
Any hint at possible change in the absolute monarchy, founded in 1932, is keenly watched as the OPEC kingpin pumps about 8,2 million barrels of crude per day.
Abdullah is credited with advancing much-needed reforms in the ultra-conservative Islamic state since he became king in 2005, and maintaining the country as a staunch ally of the United States. - Sapa-AFP

description.hltext_display: 第四屆台灣工藝之家 陳慧芬、林時植分獲殊榮 (NOWnews)
description.content:
第4屆台灣工藝之家徵選活名單正式出爐，新竹市由專事木雕佛像彩繪及漆藝創作的陳慧芬老師，以及陶藝雕塑家林時植老師通過授證，授證儀式23日上午於國立臺灣工藝研究發展中心舉行。
本屆「臺灣工藝之家」遴選，全國共計有170位工藝家參加徵選，入選有20位，新竹市2位獲選。市府表示，「台灣工藝之家」是各縣市歷年推薦選拔出的優秀工藝家，工作室開放民眾參觀，讓民眾貼近藝術家的創作過程，以推廣藝術生活化，啟發文化創意產業及發展，將可帶動地方觀光。
文化局長林榮洲表示，新竹市每屆提報各領域工藝創作家參加角逐「台灣工藝之家」，在眾多優秀競技下，目前已有黃安福、李文福、許源榮、林啟燦、許金烺、蕭在淦、葉佳讓、蔡楊吉、葉佐燁等9位包括玻璃、木雕、陶藝、花燈等不同領域藝術家，連同新獲選的陳慧芬、林時植二位老師，共計有十一位。
陳慧芬老師專長木雕佛像彩繪及漆藝創作，藝術創作生涯近30年，作品特色在不斷追求創新與突破下，由傳統神像雕刻逐漸走向現代雕刻，工作室位於高峰路386巷85弄27號，電話03-5242495。
林時植老師，從事立體陶藝雕塑及複合媒材創作，年輕優秀，是現任新竹市美術協會理事，作品曾獲南瀛美展首獎、新竹美展首獎，在全國性各項美術比賽中屢獲大獎，他將父親的鐵工廠蛻變成文創工作室，作品為各界肯定。工作室位於中華路三段120號，電話03-5282375。受證掛牌後，歡迎有興趣的民眾預約參訪，體驗藝術家的創作過程與傳統藝術之美。

description.hltext_display: 2010中国十大并购”评选活动启动
description.content:
“中国十大并购”评选活动由全国工商联并购公会、全球并购研究中心、中国并购交易网举办。从2000年至今，“中国十大并购”评选已连续成功举办了10年，评选活动将中国经济领域的风云人物和极具震撼力的焦点事件几乎全部网罗其中，事件本身及评选备受并购业界和海内外经济界所瞩目。2010年度评选活动必将再一次引起社会各界的普遍关注。
2010年“中国十大并购”评选将继续秉承公平、公信、公正的原则，以专业的角度和权威的评判，根据开创性、责任感、影响力、推动力及阳光并购等一级指标以及创新精神、社会责任、行业发展、社会影响、价值创造等二级指标，经过社会征集、推荐评选、专家书面评选等方式，最终选出“2010中国十大并购人物”和“2010中国十大并购事件”。
2010年“中国十大并购”评选对中国并购市场逐渐走向规范和成熟，对中国企业的全球化进程，必将起到巨大的推动作用。

description.hltext_display: NBA／鐵面人遭球隊批「背骨」 漢米爾頓與活塞緊張 (NOWnews)
description.content:
底特律活塞隊近年成績平平，過去輝煌時期所僅存下來的主將「鐵面人」漢米爾頓（Richard Hamilton），與球隊裂痕卻愈來愈大，日前《底特律新聞》指稱他是球隊不安定因素，甚至批他「背離球隊」，漢米爾頓聽聞之後極感失望，表示對於流言覺得相當難過。
風波似乎愈演愈烈，活塞總裁杜馬斯（Joe Dumars）指出，目前他正在為球隊買賣煩惱中，現在漢米爾頓的表現又不是很好，如果再這樣下去，他會變得有點站不住腳。杜馬斯表示，「如果有需要和他好好聊聊，我會這麼做。我明天會看大家對他的想法，這個做法對我來說是比較好的。」
漢米爾頓聽到球隊人員背後對他說三道四表示，「最痛心的事，在這個組織裡竟然有人說我『背骨』，我很難過，因為過去球9個球季我竭盡全力，每晚打得認真，且具侵略性。聽到這種指控，這對我來說很苦情。」（看漢米爾頓超強單場51分影片請到：http://www.nownews.com/2010/12/22/341-2675743.htm)
「鐵面人」與球隊合約還有3年才到期，明年年薪為1250萬美元，2010-11年球季平均出賽26.4分鐘，得到13.6分，創下加入活塞以來的最低紀錄。過去兩季漢米爾頓都在交易名單之中，最後謠言皆未成真，如今成績不如以往，又與球隊關係緊張，未來他的地位恐更加險峻。

description.hltext_display: Participation yéménite à la réunion consultative pour la protection des végétaux au Proche-Orient au Caire
description.content: [22/ديسمبر/2010] SANA'A, 22 Déc. (SABA)- Le Yémen prend part à la réunion consultative pour la protection des végétaux au Proche-Orient, qui entame ses travaux aujourd'hui au Caire. La réunion, organisée par l'Organisation des Nations Unies pour l'Alimentation et l'Agriculture (FAO), discutera des questions relatives au développement des mécanismes de la lutte contre les ravageurs des végétaux, y compris la création d'un réseau d'information pour protéger les végétaux au niveau des pays de la région. Dans une déclaration faite à SABA, le directeur général du Département de la protection des végétaux au sein du ministère de l'Agriculture et de l'Irrigation , Abdallah Al-Sayani, a expliqué que le projet, financé par l'Union Européenne, vise à sensibiliser les agriculteurs d'utiliser les pesticides agricoles. Il a ajouté que le Yémen participera, lors de cette réunion, d'un document de travail sur l'expérience yéménite dans le domaine de la gestion intégrée de lutte contre les maladies et les ravageurs des cultures. AS/AS SABA

description.hltext_display: Asylum boat orphan relatives land in Australia
description.content:
Australian officials on Wednesday said they had found two aunts of a young refugee orphaned in last week's asylum boat sinking on later people-smuggling boats and arrangements were underway for a reunion.
The child, believed to be an Iranian boy aged about eight, was among three who lost both parents in last Wednesday's horrific boat smash off remote Christmas Island, killing an estimated 48 of the 90 refugees on board.
He was made a ward of Immigration Minister Chris Bowen after his status as an unaccompanied minor was established, but a department spokesman said two of his aunts had since been discovered on boats which arrived in the past week.
"Now that we've identified family that he does have, two aunts who were aboard a vessel that subsequently has come in to Christmas Island, we'll work with psychologists now to facilitate a reunion," the spokesman told ABC radio.
"That will be as advised by the psychologists when it is most appropriate."
All three orphans were being kept in a low-security facility on Christmas Island -- home to Australia's main immigration detention centre -- with family members and social workers while officials assessed their plight.
Prime Minister Julia Gillard has said minors and families from the shipwreck will live in the community under a new policy announced in October in a bid to ease severe overcrowding in Australia's detention centres.
Three boats have been intercepted off Australia since last week's disaster, carrying more than 150 asylum seekers.
More than 6,500 people, mostly Iraqis, Afghans and Sri Lankans, have tried to reach Australia this year on rickety boats from Indonesia, prompting debate about Canberra's relaxation of the former conservative government's harsh refugee policies.

event_or_fact.property: minors and families from the shipwreck will live in the community under a new policy announced in October in a bid to ease severe overcrowding in Australia's detention centres

description.hltext_display: Etats-Unis: un hôpital catholique sanctionné par l'Eglise après un avortement
description.author: info@lesechos.fr
description.content:
Un prestigieux hôpital de Phoenix, dans l'Arizona (sud-ouest des Etats-Unis) s'est vu retirer mardi son statut d'hôpital catholique par les autorités religieuses, pour avoir procédé en novembre 2009 à un avortement thérapeutique pour sauver la vie de la mère.
L'hôpital St. Joseph ne pourra plus être qualifié de catholique et les messes ne pourront plus y être célébrées, a annoncé Thomas J. Olmsted, évêque de Phoenix.
"Le bébé était sain et la grossesse ne présentait aucun problème", assure l'évêque dans un communiqué. "C'est la mère qui était malade et qui devait être soignée. Mais au lieu de traiter sa maladie, les médecin et le comité d'éthique de l'hôpital ont décidé que le bébé sain de 11 semaines devait être tué. C'est contraire aux enseignements de l'Eglise", ajoute-t-il.
"Bien que profondément déçus, nous continuerons à remplir résolument notre mission", a rétorqué la présidente de l'hôpital, Linda Hunt, dans un communiqué. "Nos modes opératoires, notre politique et nos procédures ne changeront pas".
Mme Hunt défend vigoureusement la décision de l'hôpital de procéder à l'avortement, pour sauver la vie de la mère.
"En accord avec nos valeurs de dignité et de justice, si nous sommes en présence d'une situation dans laquelle une grossesse met en danger la vie d'une femme, notre première priorité est de sauver les deux patients", dit-elle.
"Si ce n'est pas possible, nous sauverons toujours la vie que nous pouvons sauver, et c'est ce que nous avons fait dans ce cas", poursuit-elle. "Moralement, éthiquement et légalement, nous ne pouvons tout simplement pas laisser quelqu'un mourir si nous sommes en mesure de le sauver".
L'évêque Olmsted, qui a excommunié la soeur qui avait donné son accord à l'avortement thérapeutique, reproche également à l'hôpital St. Joseph et à l'institution qui l'exploite, Catholic Healthcare West (CHW), d'avoir "coopéré pendant des années avec plusieurs programmes médicaux contraires aux directives éthiques et religieuses" de l'Eglise catholique.

description.hltext_display: States Parties to Child Rights Convention Elect Eight Candidates as Members of Monitoring ...
Inflation cools in November
description.content:
Annual inflation cooled in November and the Canadian consumer is increasingly pessimistic, reports released Tuesday showed, buying the Bank of Canada time before it's forced to hike interest rates again.
Consumer prices rose 2% in the 12 months ending November, down from the 2.4% annual gain registered in October, Statistic Canada said Tuesday. The slowdown in inflation came as the cost of energy, food and clothing items fell.
Month-over-month, the Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose 0.1% in November, less than the 0.3% gain expected.
"After a scary pop in both headline and core inflation in the previous month, both CPI metrics have pulled comfortably back, solidifying the assertion that inflation is simply not an issue in Canada," TD economist Francis Fong said in a note.
Overall energy prices increased 6.7% in the 12 months ended November, following a 9.1% gain for October. Prices at the pump were 7.2% higher than a year earlier after a rise of 9.1% in October. Vehicle price increases also slowed to 3.9% compared to 4.9% in the 12 months ending October.
In all provinces, the cost of just about everything rose in the past year with the exception of clothing and footwear.
The core rate, most closely watched by the Bank of Canada in making decisions on interest rates, rose 1.4% on the year, compared with 1.8% in October.
"Today's report reverses the pricing surprise seen in the October number set. On that basis it certainly provides the BoC will some increased elbow room on the policy front," HSBC Canada economist Stewart Hall said.
Canada's central bank head Mark Carney is stuck between a rock and a hard place. On the one hand, there's pressure to raise interest rates as Canadians take on record debt loads. On the other, higher rates would further strengthen the currency harming already weak exports.
"On balance, maintaining the economic recovery appears to take precedent in this balancing act and we anticipate that the Bank will stay on hold until the second half of 2011," Fong said.
A new Conference Board of Canada poll suggests Carney's repeated warnings about excessive levels of household debt may be registering with Canadians. The think-tank's latest measure of confidence fell 2.6 points in December to a reading of 81, closing out the year virtually unchanged from December 2009. The overall balance of opinion fell on three of the four survey questions, with consumers showing particular concern over their future finances.
A separate report by Statistics Canada also released Tuesday suggests October's steep rise in consumer prices may have hurt merchants.
Retail sales did increase for the fifth straight month in October but only because of higher prices at the pumps.
"(It's) a somewhat disappointing story underneath a decent print on the headline," Hall said.
Overall retail sales rose 0.8% to $36.6 billion in the month, beating expectations for a more modest 0.5% rise. But stripping away gasoline sales, retailers actually saw revenues and volumes drop.
Sales at Canada's gas stations were up 7.4% in October, mainly reflecting higher prices.
Department and other general merchandise stores saw sales drop 1.2% while spending on food and beverage also fell 0.2%.
And following three straight gains, sales of clothing and accessories came in 0.8% lower.
On the bright side, sales of furniture and home furnishings did edge up 2.2%. So, too, did sales of other discretionary items like leather goods and jewelry.
Gift, pet, stationary and other miscellaneous stores saw sales jump 1.4% after losing ground in each of the past 10 months.
Sales were up in nine provinces, with Ontario being the largest contributor to the increase. The only decline was posted by Manitoba, where sales fell 0.5% for the second month in a row.
On the heels of Monday's disappointing manufacturing sales report, the October retail sales numbers pose some added downside risk to Thursday's gross domestic product report, Hall said. He's expecting monthly GDP growth to come in at around 0.29%.

event_or_fact.property: Today's report reverses the pricing surprise seen in the October number set.; On that basis it certainly provides the BoC will some increased elbow room on the policy front
On balance, maintaining the economic recovery appears to take precedent in this balancing act and we anticipate that the Bank will stay on hold until the second half of 2011
After a scary pop in both headline and core inflation in the previous month, both CPI metrics have pulled comfortably back, solidifying the assertion that inflation is simply not an issue in Canada

description.hltext_display: 정부, 구제역 ‘예방백신’ 접종키로
description.content:
정부는 경북 안동에서 시작된 구제역이 경기에 이어 강원 지역으로까지 확대됨에 따라 구제역 대책의 ‘마지막 수단’인 예방백신을 접종키로 내부 방침을 정한 것으로 22일 알려졌다.
정부의 고위관계자는 이날 연합뉴스와의 통화에서 “구제역 사태가 심각한 상황으로 치닫고 있어 정부 내부에서는 구제역 예방백신을 접종하기로 결론이 났다”고 밝혔다. ▲ 구제역 김포에 유입
경기도 김포시 월곶면 갈산리 돼지사육농장에서 구제역이 발생한 22일 오후 방역요원들이 농장진입로에서 출입차량을 소독하고 있다. 김포=연합뉴스 이 관계자는 그러나 “예방백신의 접종 범위 등에 대해선 아직 확정되지 않았다”면서 “오늘 오후 4시 농림수산식품부가 주관하는 긴급 가축방역협의회에서 구체적인 범위가 정해질 것으로 안다”고 덧붙였다.
정부의 이런 방침은 국내 최고의 청정지역인 강원 평창에서 구제역이 처음으로 발생한데다 인근 화천에서도 잇따라 구제역이 나오는 등 구제역 사태가 확산되고 있는 데 따른 것이다.또 춘천에 이어 원주에서도 이날 잇따라 의심신고가 접수된 것도 백신접종을 선택한 동인으로 작용한 것으로 보인다.
이에 따라 농식품부는 유정복 장관 주재로 가축방역협의회를 열어 예방백신의 접종 범위를 확정할 예정이다.
백신 접종은 지난 2000년 구제역 당시 단 한 차례 사용했던 처방으로 예방접종 중단 뒤 1년이 지나야 구제역 청정국 지위가 회복될 뿐만 아니라 비용도 만만치 않아 세계 각국이 꺼리고 있는 마지막 수단이다.
가축 10만마리를 기준으로 백신을 처방하면 6억원가량 비용이 드는 것으로 추산되고 있다.국내에는 한우 300만마리,돼지 1천만마리 정도가 사육되고 있다.
예방백신 접종은 △구제역 진원지를 중심으로 일정한 반경내 지역을 접종하는 ‘링 백신’,△특정 지역 전체를 접종하는 ‘지역 백신’ △전국에 걸쳐 접종하는 ‘전국 백신’ 등 3단계로 나뉜다.
예방백신을 접종하면 접종 중단 뒤 1년이 지나서야 구제역 청정국 지위가 회복돼 국내 축산농가는 그만큼 피해가 커진다.반면 살처분.매몰 방식은 마지막 구제역 발생 이후 3개월간 구제역이 발생하지 않으면 청정국 지위가 회복된다.
이날 현재 구제역은 의심신고 64건 가운데 안동.예천.영주.영양.파주.양주.연천.고양.가평.포천.평창.화천 등 13개 지역 44건이 구제역으로 판정됐다.또 경북 일부 지역 한우농가에서 예방적 차원에서 살처분하는 과정에서도 구제역이 확인돼 전체 구제역은 3개 시.도 16개 지역에서 48건으로 늘었다.춘천과 원주의 의심신고는 빠르면 이날 저녁부터 결과가 나온다.
이번 구제역으로 지금까지 1천289농가의 소.돼지.사슴.염소 등 22만4천605마리의 가축이 살처분.매몰돼 살처분 보상금만 2천300억원을 넘어서는 등 피해규모가 눈덩이처럼 불어나 역대 최대를 넘어섰다. 연합뉴스

description.hltext_display: Jim Boren: California pols fighting for the status quo
description.content:
YOU won't find anyone in the political establishment arguing that California's current system of governing is working. Yet every reasonable reform aimed at improving governance in the Golden State is challenged by some special interest.
It seems like gridlock is working for some people or they wouldn't be trying so hard to keep the status quo. There are a couple of recent examples.
Everyone knew that California's redistricting system was rigged to keep incumbents in office.
But when voters finally took redistricting from the politicians and gave it to an independent citizens commission, lawmakers tried to block the change with a misleading ballot measure.
And when the voters decided in June that the primary election system needed changing, the open-primary solution was quickly attacked in court.
Clearly, there are people inside California's dysfunctional government making a nice living out of not getting things done.
But the momentum right now seems to be with the reformers, despite the best efforts of opponents to keep their cozy systems in place.
The independent commission doing redistricting has begun its work, and the open-primary system was confirmed by the state Supreme Court. There undoubtedly will be other legal challenges, but 2010 was a very good year for those interested in improving government in California.
Redistricting reform and open primaries will help because more moderate candidates
have a better opportunity to emerge.
Moderate candidates, as opposed to those on the far right or far left of the political spectrum, are more willing to compromise, and get things done.
The extremists on the edges of both political parties would rather stand on principle than acknowledge there's a viable position on issues other then their own.
Redistricting will make many districts more competitive. (I caution you not to expect all districts to be competitive because housing patterns will still create districts in which Democrats or Republicans will dominate.) And that means representatives in those districts will have to listen to constituents from the other party or risk losing in the next election.
The open primary system - also called the top-two primary - will have all candidates in a district running in a single primary. The top two vote-getters will advance to the runoff election.
The major parties hate this because it limits their control of the process. The minor parties hate it because they will not have a candidate in the runoff election unless they have one with enough appeal to be in the top two primary finishers.
But Californians should love the process because they will be voting in the general election on the two candidates getting the most votes in the primary, and not the two candidates propped up by the major parties.
It won't be easy fixing California. The politicians ducked the financial challenges for the past few years, and now state government must make cuts that will hurt core services. That could have been avoided, if we'd taken our medicine earlier, but those in charge refused to deal with the budget in a realistic way.
We're going to have to cycle through the current batch of lawmakers who don't know how to say no to their special-interest pals. But redistricting reform and open primaries are a good start in changing the do-nothing environment in Sacramento.
The parties don't like these changes because they will help make officeholders accountable to the voters who elect them.
We can be thankful that in redistricting reform and open primaries, the voters saw through the Democratic and Republican spin machines.
Jim Boren is The Fresno Bee's editorial page editor.

entity.property: cuts that will hurt core services

description.hltext_display: 4살 여아 병원돌다 사망…‘진료거부’ 경북대병원 등…
description.content:
보건복지부는 최근 경북대병원을 비롯한 대구시내 주요병원의 진료거부로 어린이 응급환자가 사망함에 따라 경북대병원에 대해 권역응급의료센터 지정을 취소키로 했다고 22일 밝혔다. ▲ 경북대병원 의료기관 응급실의 진료거부 행위에 대해 행정처분이 이뤄지는 것은 이번이 처음이다.
복지부는 진료거부 5개 병원중 권역응급의료센터로 지정돼 있던 경북대병원에 대해 권역응급의료센터 지정을 취소키로 하고 사전통지 및 의견청취,중앙응급의료위원회 심의 등 절차를 거쳐 내년 1월20일께 취소 여부를 최종 확정할 예정이다. 복지부는 나머지 지역응급의료센터로 지정돼 있는 4개 병원에 대해서도 내년도 응급의료기금 지원예산을 20% 일괄 감액키로 했다.
지난달 21일 대구에서 장의 한 부분이 안쪽으로 말려 들어가는 장중첩증을 앓던 네 살배기 여아 응급환자가 경북대병원 등 대구시내 5개 주요 병원 응급실을 찾아다니다 적절한 치료를 받지 못하고 끝내 경북 구미 병원에서 숨진 일이 발생했다.
경북대병원이 권역응급의료센터 지정이 취소되면 매년 2억∼4억원 가량의 응급의료기금 지원예산을 받을 수 없을 뿐 더러 환자 1인당 3만원인 응급의료관리료 수가도 받지 못해 연간 10억원 가량의 경제적 손실이 생기게 된다.
게다가 1천억원 규모의 권역외상센터 설립지 후보에서도 탈락하게 된다.
복지부 관계자는 “경북대병원이 권역응급의료센터 지정이 취소되면 향후 응급의료신규사업에는 당분간 진출이 어려울 것”이라며 “지정취소가 결정되는대로 공모에 나서 대구경북 지역의 새로운 권역응급의료센터를 지정하게 된다”고 말했다.
이 관계자는 “그간 진료거부 행위가 잇따랐지만 의료기관의 과실을 입증하기가 어려워 행정처벌을 취하기가 어려웠다”면서 “그러나 권역응급의료센터마저 진료를 거부한 것에 대해서는 일벌백계 차원의 처분이 필요하다고 봤다”고 덧붙였다. 연합뉴스

description.hltext_display: Ignatieff's challenge: Reverse a decade of Liberal decline
description.content:
OTTAWA - For all the success the Liberal Party of Canada found in the 20th century, the first decade of the 21st century has been an electoral wasteland for the group once referred to as Canada's Natural Governing
Party.
Consider the long-term trend: Through three general elections since Jean Chretien's triumph in 2000, the party has lost a combined 95 seats.
Its share of the popular vote, better than 40% in 2000, was barely 26% in 2008. The Liberal share of the popular vote had never been lower since John A. Macdonald whipped George Brown's Liberals in Canada's very first election in 1967.
And so, as 2010 comes to an end, Liberal Leader Michael Ignatieff is left to ponder: Is liberalism in Canada dead?
"I don't think so," Ignatieff said after a careful pause during a year-end interview with QMI Agency at his official Ottawa home, Stornoway.
"The key enduring fact is that the broad base of the Canadian middle class, the middle class family, depends as much as it ever did for its standard of living on health service you can rely on, public pensions, public help for post-secondary education and child care. Liberalism has always understood that."
This is the classic Liberal "big government" vision, a vision where the federal government plays the leading role in Canadian political life.
"The reason the Liberal Party's been so successful politically, is we've understood, that's what we're in politics to do, to create that ground under people's feet and to do it in a way that doesn't crush people with high taxes," Ignatieff said. "And that's been the bargain and that's why we were the governing party for so long."
And yet, the Conservatives have effectively dislodged the Liberals as the favourites of the middle class in large swaths of the country, particularly the suburbs around Ontario's large cities and throughout the West. And the NDP and Bloc Quebecois have effectively stolen many of the votes of those who would agree with the classic "big government" Liberal vision, mostly because NDP Leader Jack Layton and BQ Leader Gilles Duceppe have been more effective advocates of that vision.
Ignatieff, though, is convinced Liberals can one day rule the political roost. A key step for him towards that goal in 2010: Ending the discord within his own caucus.
"They want to win. It's just that simple," Ignatieff said. "They don't like being in opposition. We're a party that's governed the country. We're not like the Bloc or the NDP who think this is dying and going to heaven. We think this is purgatory and we want to get back to the business of governing the country and we know the only way we can do that is if we're united."
Liberals confront their wastelands
It's more than 2,200 kilometres from Winnipeg's south side to the the eastern fringes of Vancouver and, with the exception of Ralph Goodale's lonely outpost in southeastern Regina, there's not a Liberal MP to be found along that stretch.
Liberals in Ottawa are realistic that the west is likely to remain a wasteland for them at least through the next election.
"I'm not in dreamland. We've got a lot of work to do," leader Michael Ignatieff said in a year-end interview with QMI Agency.
And yet, Ignatieff does see seeds of a Western revival in places like Edmonton, where there was considerable local anger at the federal Tories because they said they wouldn't help the city cover the cost of hosting a world's fair.
"We want to say, 'You deserve better than this. You deserve someone who doesn't take you for granted,'" Ignatieff said.
Quebec looks only slightly less bleak for federal Liberals these days.
Except for one seat they hold just outside Ottawa, Liberals have only parts of Montreal they can call their own.
"We have to say, 'You Quebecers are fed up with Stephen Harper,'" Ignatieff said. "'This government does not respond to your values. This government does not understand you. If you want to get rid of Stephen Harper, you've got to vote for the Liberals. If you keep voting for Gilles Duceppe you will get four more years of a government that doesn't understand you.'"
Still, Ignatieff realizes Liberals have much heavy slogging to do to get voters to ditch the Bloc.
"If you're out on the ground in Quebec, in small towns, municipal officials come up to you on the quiet all the time and say, 'We've voted for those [BQ] guys for 18 years. What the hell did they do for my community?' If I've heard that once I've heard it a hundred times. Well, sooner or later, that begins to translate into votes."

They want to win.; It's just that simple; They don't like being in opposition. We're aparty that's governed the country. We're not like the Bloc or the NDP who think this is dying and going to heaven. We think this is purgatory and we want to get back to

description.hltext_display: FCC ruling paves the way for a government takeover.
Kontestan Aksi Anak Bangsa Ngamen di Ruangan DPRD
description.content:
Surabaya (beritajatim.com) - Dalam perjalanan menuju kontes bernyanyi yang digelar oleh RCTI, Deva Ananda Arjunkar (7 tahun) peserta Aksi Anak Bangsa yang masuk dalam tujuh besar asal Surabaya, nekad ngamen di lingkungan DPRD Surabaya. Deva mengaku kebingungan untuk biaya menuju Jakarta.
Dengan santai dan diiringi kerabatnya, Devan mengunjungi ruangan-ruangan komisi yang ada di DPRD Surabaya. Devan menyanyi dengan peralatan seadanya, yakni menggunakan pengeras suara di ruangan fraksi yang biasa digunakan untuk rapat. Dari hasil ngamennya, pengamen jalanan ini mampu meraup uang Rp 2.350.000 hanya dalam hitungan menit.
Didampingi tiga pengasuhnya, Deva yang mahir memainkan ukulele tak sungkan masuk ke ruang-ruang komisi yang kebetulan masih dipenuhi anggota dewan, Selasa (21/12/2010). Dia membawakan beberapa lagu, di antaranya Garuda di Dadaku, Ayah, dan beberapa lagu lainnya.
Deva mendapat applause dari anggota dewan. Sayangnya, anak jalanan yang tinggal di kawasan Jetis Gang Pertolongan, sampai umurnya saat ini, tak pernah mengenyam bangku sekolah.
Secara khusus, Ketua DPRD Wisnu Wardhana memberikan aplaus kepada pengamen jalanan cilik ini. Wisnu juga berpesan agar Deva tetap mempertahankan prestasinya sehingga bisa menjadi wakil Surabaya untuk memenangkan acara tersebut.
"Saya juga berpesan kepada warga Surabaya untuk mendukung Deva agar bisa menjadi juara pada acara itu," ujar Wisnu.
Sementara salah satu pengasuh Deva, Heri Purwanto menjelaskan, dirinya sudah mengasuh Deva sejak kecil. Deva menurut dia, adalah anak yang ditinggal ayahnya. Deva selama ini hanya tinggal dengan ibunya yang hidup serba kekurangan. Karena itu Deva membantu keluarganya dalam mencari nafkah dengan cara mengamen di jalan-jalan.
Deva sendiri mengaku mengikuti Aksi Anak Bangsa berharap dapat menjadi juara untuk bisa membantu kehidupan keluarganya. "Saya ingin membahagiakan ibu," pungkas Devan polos. [rif/but]

description.hltext_display: Cop charged in G20 assault
description.content:
TORONTO - A Toronto police officer is now charged with assaulting G20 protester Adam Nobody.
The provincial police watchdog Special Investigations Unit said Tuesday that Const. Babak Andalib-Goortani was charged with assault with a weapon.
The charge follows the SIU saying Nov. 25 that excessive force was used on Nobody on June 26 at Queen's Park but were unable to identify anyone in the video evidence, which was shown on YouTube.
The case regained momentum after Chief Bill Blair said on CBC Radio One on Nov. 29 that the video had been tampered with, and suggested Nobody was violent.
He said that the police were arresting a violent armed offender and that a segment depicting the use of a weapon had been removed from the tape, the SIU said.
The following day, videographer John Bridge told the SIU there was a gap of a few seconds in the tape because he thought the police were about to catch up to him. He turned off his camera and turned it on again when he saw Nobody arrested. There was no tampering or editing, he told the SIU.
The SIU took Bridge's sworn statement and re-opened the probe into Nobody's arrest.
The floodgates opened when other protesters provided pictures and other video of the same scene to the SIU and media outlets.
The SIU said on Dec. 9, Toronto Police provided the names of 15 officers who might have been in the vicinity or involved in Nobody's arrest.
"The information was provided in response to a request by the SIU the (Toronto Police Service) ascertain and disclose the names of all officers involved in Mr. Nobody's arrest or who might have information regarding the identity of the officers involved in the arrest," SIU director Ian Scott said in a release.

description.hltext_display: Ennio Morricono to Compose Ringtones for LG Smartphones
description.content:
­LG Electronics has announced the release of an exclusive collection of music and ringtones written by movie soundtrack maestro Ennio Morricone. The first such collaboration of its kinds, both newly composed pieces as well as a selection from Morricone's legendary oeuvre, including Cinema Paradiso, The Mission and Love Affair, will be included in the collection.
The agreement covers 25 of Morricone's creations -- 15 ringtones composed specifically for LG and 10 of his best-known tunes from the world of cinema, while the tunes will be preloaded on LG smartphones starting with the LG Optimus 2X set to debut next month in Europe.
Born in Italy, Morricone is one of the most prolific and influential film composers in the world. He has composed and arranged scores for more than 500 films and TV programs over his illustrious career.
"Signore Morricone is one of the best-loved soundtrack composers of all time," said Dr. Jong-seok Park, President and CEO of LG Electronics Mobile Communications Company. "Reproducing his work with such amazing clarity on the Optimus 2X, gives smartphones a whole new level of respect as the primary device for on-the-go music."
In addition to the collection of 25 ringtones and music, LG plans to develop a range of apps with Morricone-related content such as images and video clips for free downloading from the LG Application Store starting next year.

description.hltext_display: 轮值主席、轮值秘书长到访并购公会秘书处
description.content: 2010年12月21日，并购公会本届轮值主席陈有安先生和轮值秘书长李梅女士在并购公会秘书处与王巍会长、葛明副会长共同就公会明年工作进行了交流与沟通。王巍会长介绍了2011年度并购公会的主要工作安排与计划，陈有安主席充分认可了公会的业界影响力和在社会责任等职能作用方面所发挥的重要作用，表示作为本届轮值主席单位-银河证券愿意汇同秘书处全体人员共同努力，全力做好公会明年的工作。

description.hltext_display: Coast Guard Cutter plays part of Santa's Sleigh
Court to rule on cloning and reproduction law
description.content:
OTTAWA - The Supreme Court will issue a ruling Wednesday that could dramatically change the way in vitro fertilization and other forms of assisted human reproduction are carried out in Canada.
Quebec is challenging several sections of the Assisted Human Reproduction Act, claiming parts of the law go too far and infringe on provincial jurisdiction. The province says it has no problem with parts of the law that outlaw chimeras — the creation of human-animal hybrids — but maintains other sections, such as how embryos are handled and how consent can be given, should be regulated by the province.
The law was passed in 2004, and Quebec's court challenge was launched in 2008. It has taken 20 months for the Supreme Court to rule.
The law was a sweeping attempt to set regulations on what scientists can do with human reproductive materials such as eggs, sperm and embryos. While some countries such as Britain have allowed the creation of human-animal hybrids for embryonic stem cell research, this law bans that kind of activity in Canada.
The law also bans the creation of human clones, sex selection prior to in vitro transplant, transplanting non-human life into humans and paying surrogate mothers for their services.
Quebec, which is supported by Alberta, Saskatchewan and New Brunswick, doesn't oppose any of those provisions. Its argument against certain provisions of the law is that it veers too close to regulating health care, including the doctor-patient relationship, which falls under provincial jurisdiction.
The federal government, supported by the Canadian Conference of Catholic Bishops and the Evangelical Fellowship of Canada, argued before the court that all sections of the act fall within the federal power to regulate under the Criminal Code.
If the contentious portions of the law are deemed invalid, each province would be free to regulate in areas of assisted human reproduction, such as the consent of donors, and transgenics, which is the combining of human and non-human genomes.

description.hltext_display: Rush's comments on ESPN Sunday NFL Countdown.
Plowing To Continue
description.content: A truck plowing operation began Tuesday morning in Winnipeg, as a result of the snow that fell overnight. The plows began on "priority-2" streets which includes bus routes and collections. They'll continue the effort through the day, and into this evening until it's done. Crews are still putting down salt as required. The city is also plowing sidewalks on main routes, bus routes and collector streets. About 130 pieces of equipment are being used in the plowing operation which is expected to cost about 250-thousand dollars.

description.hltext_display: Woman Killed In Crash Identified
description.content:
CJOB News Team reporting
Police have identified the woman killed when struck by a bus Monday at Portage and Sherbrooke. Dead is 67 year old Gittel Goertzen of Winnipeg. No charges laid in this one but the investigation continues.

description.hltext_display: Seoul Eyes Crackdown on North Korean Internet Propaganda
description.content:
The South Korean government plans to further restrict its citizens from accessing and relaying information on the Internet that is sympathetic to North Korea.
IDG News Service — The South Korean government plans to further restrict its citizens from accessing and relaying information on the Internet that is sympathetic to North Korea.
Outlining its plans for 2011, the country's Justice Ministry said it will "try to block North Korea's propaganda activity through social-networking services, such as Twitter."
The plans build on South Korea's existing Internet filtering and come at a time of increased tensions between the two neighbors.
Websites judged to be sympathetic to Pyongyang have been blocked by the South Korean government for several years. The sites are largely those of organizations based in China or Japan with links to North Korea. South Korean Internet users attempting to access the sites are redirected to a National Police Agency page indicating that the site is forbidden in South Korea.
Until recently, North Korean propaganda on social media networks wasn't much of a problem, but that changed in July when Uriminzokkiri, a China-based site with close ties to Pyongyang, opened a Twitter account.
The Twitter feed carried headlines and links to news stories on the organization's website. It was followed by a Facebook group and accounts on Flickr and YouTube. The Facebook page was quickly closed but the other accounts remain active.
Within a few weeks of its appearance, South Korean authorities moved to block access to the Twitter channel but the result was symbolic at best. While the account page is blocked, Twitter messages from the account can still be seen when the site is accessed via a secure HTTPS connection or via any of the hundreds of applications that use Twitter's API (application programming interface.)
The Twitter feed currently has 10,545 followers including some that appear to be in South Korea.
Under existing legislation, it is already illegal for South Koreans to take part in exchanges with North Korea without first getting permission from the South Korean government. The "Inter-Korea Exchange and Cooperation Act" provides for up to three years in prison or fines of up to 10 million won (US$8,660) for doing so.
The Justice Ministry hasn't detailed how it plans to limit the spread of North Korean propaganda in cyberspace, but this existing law could be part of its plans. Lawmakers said earlier this year that any attempts to communicate with North Korean social media accounts could be considered a violation.
The ministry also said it plans to crackdown on those circulating false reports on the Internet that could affect national security.
Earlier this month it indicted 19 people for spreading rumors in the wake of North Korea's shelling of Yeonpyeong Island. The 19 sent text messages saying or implying the government was calling up reserve military forces, but the government never did.
(Hyuna Kim in Seoul contributed to this report.)
Martyn Williams covers Japan and general technology breaking news for The IDG News Service. Follow Martyn on Twitter at @martyn_williams. Martyn's e-mail address is martyn_williams@idg.com

description.hltext_display: Yellow Police Tape To Encourage Crimestoppers Tips
description.content:
CJOB News Team reporting
Soon you will see ads for Crimestoppers placed on yellow police tape that surrounds crime scenes. The board of Crimestoppers figures placing the number on the tape may result in more tips coming in. Over 13-thousand cases have been cleared since the inception of Crimestoppers in Winnipeg in 1984.

description.hltext_display: 'Agreement' reached on aircraft export credits
description.content:
Major passenger aircraft manufacturing countries have reached agreement on reforming the contested system of export credits to boost sales, a source close to the negotiations said Wednesday.
"An agreement was reached yesterday evening. It concerns Europe, the United States, Brazil and Canada. And the governments should approve it by February 1," the source told AFP.
Major aircraft manufacturing countries have been holding talks for months at the Paris headquarters of the the Organisation of Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) on reforming the so-called export credits.
European manufacturer Airbus and Boeing of the United States have defended the current system, saying it helps many foreign airlines to finance their aircraft purchases.
Major airlines in Europe and the United States oppose the current system, complaining that it unfairly supports their competitors in the Gulf.
A reform was also necessary to take into account new competitors in the passenger aircraft market such as the Brazilian company Embraer and Canadian Bombardier.

entity.property: Organisation of Economic Cooperation and Development

description.hltext_display: Feds, oil industry need to step up on oilsands: Baird
description.content:
OTTAWA - The oilsands industry's environmental monitoring has no scientific leadership and isn't releasing transparent scientific information, a federal panel said Tuesday.
It also can't explain water quality problems in the region.
The panel was reporting after two months of research and interviews in Alberta's oil patch.
In September, then-environment minister Jim Prentice set up the panel and admitted he was worried the water downstream from Alberta's oilsands industry wasn't properly monitored.
The Regional Aquatic Monitoring Program, an industry-funded organization, monitors the water.
On Monday, Alberta Environment Minister Rob Renner announced a panel will start work next month on developing a "world-class" monitoring and reporting system for the oilsands.
Prentice said at the time the industry's monitoring was a key question in the process.
"Whether or not the RAMP is producing the right data is very much at the heart of this issue."
A spokesman for RAMP said he hadn't heard Prentice criticize them directly before, but they're confident in the data they collect.
Elizabeth Dowdeswell, a former director of the UN's Environment Program, chaired the panel. The other five members were Trent University's Peter
Dillon, McGill University's Subhasis Ghoshal, Andrew Miall from the University of Toronto, Joseph Rasmussen from the University of Lethbridge and Queen's University's John Smol.
Prentice decided to set up the panel after he met with David Schindler, an Alberta scientist who released a study in September that showed pollutants downstream from oilsands developments, including mercury, arsenic, lead and cadmium - metals known to be toxic at trace levels, he said.
Opposition MPs said Schindler should have been included on the panel. They argue Prentice was slow to respond to ongoing criticism over water problems around the oilsands.
When the panel was created, Smol said he was impressed with the other
members and expected lively discussions.
"We've hardly been people who have, let's say, toed the government line on too many things," he said, referring to his work on climate change and acid rain.

description.hltext_display: Marijuana Grow Op Behind Alexander Avenue Fire
Charges Laid In Manitoba Hog Farm Operation
description.content:
CJOB News Team reporting
A Manitoba hog farmer from Notre Dame has now been formally charged after a large number of hogs were found dead and decomposing in a barn last summer. A Colony had contacted police concerned they were denied access to 2-thousand hogs they owned, that were being boarded at the farm. Martin Grenier is now facing six counts of charges...ranging from causing pain and suffering.. to failing to provide adequate food, water and shelter.

description.hltext_display: Drivers Survive Head-On Collision Near Altona
description.content:
CJOB News Team reporting
Scary moments outside Altona Tuesday morning when two vehicles collided head-on, on high 201. A 64-year old man from Dominion City had to be extricated from his vehicle. He was taken to hospital with non-life threatening injuries. The 17-year old girl driving the other car.. was taken to hospital and released. Police say roads were snow covered, and blowing snow reduced visibility at the time.

description.hltext_display: Bombers Cite New Revenue Streams To Help Pay For Stadium
description.content:
The Winnipeg Blue Bombers have detailed how they're going to pay for their portion of the construction of a new football stadium. As Board Chairman Bill Watchorn explains, it will be an 85-million dollar contribution over 44 years for one-third ownership/interest of the stadium and a long term management agreement to operate the facility.
Here are details of the plan, as outlined by Bill Watchorn.
Watchorn calls the plan both reasonable and realistic. He says there are several new revenue streams not currently available with the existing facility. The 4 principle revenue streams are expected to generate revenues in excess of one million dollars each.

description.hltext_display: Lilo attackerade en Betty Ford-arbetare!
description.content:
När kommer någon att kasta in Lindsay Lohan i fängelse där hon hör hemma? Tjejen är uppenbarligen fortfarande utom kontroll! Den fulla sanningen har kommit ut om vad som hände i helgen på Lindsay Lohans andra hem, Betty Fords rehabcenter där hon bott de senaste månaderna.
Här är vad som hände. Lindsay och hennes rumskamrater gick till en bar och kom hem sent, trots att de har ett utegångsförbud efter en viss tid. De försökte hoppa över en vägg så att ingen skulle lägga märke till dem, men blev självklart tagna på bar gärning. När de hotade Lindsay med ett alkoholtest, blev hon helt galen, ringde 112 och försökte dra åt sig en telefon from en Betty Ford-arbetares hand, vilket gav kvinnan en sprucken handled och tvingade henne ta sjukledigt. Istället för att Lindsay skulle hamna i knipa, har arbetaren nu sparkats från Betty Ford för att hon talade till pressen och Lindsay är undergår "intensiv terapi".
Självklart var allt drama till för att slippa göra ett alkoholtest och Lilo kom undan med det, eftersom det nu inte finns något bevis att hon druckit på en bar den kvällen. Som vi sa igår, den här tjejen är bortom all hjälp! (Källa: TMZ)
Relaterade bildserier "Dancing with the Stars" vill ha Lilo! Lindsay Lohan har flyttat... De 10 värsta fejkbrännorna någonsin! Kändisar som håller koll på klockan!

description.hltext_display: Five schools help Winnipeg Harvest
description.content:
CJOB News Team reporting
Five schools in the Westwood area of Winnipeg joined forces this month and collected 10,000 cans of food to support Winnipeg Harvest..
School officials say they worked together to help students value the concept of social justice and recognize its importance for the betterment of an ever-changing world..
The schools involved included Westwood Collegiate, Ecole Robert Browning school, Lincoln Middle school, Phoenix school and Sansome school..

description.hltext_display: Accident snarls traffic on perimeter
description.content:
CJOB News Team reporting
A traffic accident closed the east bound lanes of the Perimeter highway late Tuesday afternoon, from PTH 8 to PTH 9..
The lanes were reopened around 8:30 Tuesday evening
There were no reports of any serious injuries after a truck and SUV collided around 5:30 pm..
RCMP and Highways officials are reminding motorists of the very slippery conditions on highways around the city especially on the Perimeter..

description.hltext_display: RCMP investigating death of baby girl
description.content:
CJOB News Team reporting
RCMP are investigating the death of a baby girl in the R-M of Portage La Prairie. The girl was less than a year old..
RCMP constable Miles Hiebert told CJOB officers were called to a house in the R-M around Noon Tuesday.. Police have yet to determine if the death was suspicious..
Police would not confirm the death occured on the Long Plain first nation, just west of Portage la Prairie.
An autopsy was being performed to determine the cause of death..

event_or_fact.property: were called to a house in the R-M around Noon Tuesday.

распечатать| поместить в блог Вторая ракетка мира Роджер Федерер, обыгравший вчера в Цюрихе в первом благотворительном матче первую ракетку мира Рафаэля Надаля 4:6, 6:3, 6:3, вспомнил, что победа испанца в первой партии была «спланирована» в популярном промо-ролике игры.
«Могло показаться, что мы договорились, но на это не так. Нам действительно было тяжело играть на этом корте, ведь у нас не было времени к нему привыкнуть. Его собрали аккурат к матчу. Но я все равно счастлив, счастлив, что Рафа приехал сюда. Мы старались показать свою лучшую игру, и, думаю, зрителям она понравилась.
Атмосфера была совсем другой – ведь это не турнирный поединок. Все внимание было обращено лишь на одну игру и двух теннисистов. Перед матчем я ощущал серьезное давление, но под вечер стало неважно, кто победит. Это событие посвящено благой цели – помочь детям Африки. Все вырученные деньги пойдут на их поддержку, и я очень горд той работой, которую мы проделали. Спасибо всем еще раз», – приводит слова швейцарца «Евроспорт».

description.hltext_display: Galaxy star Donovan will forgo loan this offseason
description.content:
CARSON - Landon Donovan is staying put this offseason, forgoing the chance to be loaned to a European club for the third straight winter.
Donovan scored two goals in 13 matches during a loan to Everton from last January to March, helping the Toffees beat Chelsea and Manchester United, and draw against Arsenal.
Everton manager David Moyes appeared open to having the 28-year-old return.
"While I enjoyed my time at Everton last season and still appreciate all the support their fans have given me, I feel that it is important to continue to rest and recover this offseason as opposed to going on loan," Donovan said in a statement Tuesday. "I never considered being loaned to a club other than Everton, but I have been playing nearly nonstop for the past two years and I believe that this decision will allow me to perform at my best for the Galaxy and the national team throughout the upcoming year."
Donovan spent the early part of 2009 on loan to Bayern Munich, then rejoined the Galaxy.
After a summer in which he played for the U.S. at the Confederations Cup, he returned to the Galaxy, took a short break, then joined Everton. That started a 10-month stretch that included the World Cup, where he had three goals for the Americans, including a stoppage-time score against Algeria that advanced the U.S. to the knockout phase.
Donovan said during the MLS playoffs last month that overcoming the mental fatigue was more challenging thanyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); dealing with the physical. Despite missing time for the World Cup, Donovan scored seven goals for the Galaxy and led MLS with 16 assists.
"We think (it's) in the best interest of the club and the player that Landon continues his postseason break and begins preparations for what will be a challenging year in 2011 at both the domestic and international levels," Galaxy coach Bruce Arena said.
Donovan and all other veterans were bypassed for the U.S. training camp ahead of a Jan.22 exhibition against Chile. He likely will rejoin the national team for a contemplated March 26 home exhibition against Argentina.
Franklin, DeLaGarza selected for U.S. camp
Galaxy defenders Sean Franklin (Highland High/CSUN) and A.J. DeLaGarza were among 12 players with no international experience selected for a U.S. national team training camp ahead of the exhibition against Chile.
Six of the 24 players on the roster have played just one game for the national team, all in the second half of 2011. Orebro midfielder Alejandro Bedoya is the senior player on the roster with six international appearances.
Others with no international experience include goalkeepers Dominic Cervi of Glasgow Celtic, Sean Johnson of Chicago, Matt Pickens of Colorado and Anthony Wallace of Colorado; defender Zach Loyd of Dallas, Ryan Miller of Sweden's Halmstads; midfielders Eric Alexander of Dallas and Jeff Larentowicz of Colorado; and Chivas USA forward Justin Braun and San Jose forward Chris Wondolowski.
Among those with just one appearance are defenders Omar Gonzalez of the Galaxy and Tim Ream of New York; midfielders Brek Shea of Dallas and Mikkel Diskerud of Norway's Stabaek; and forward Juan Agudelo of New York and Teal Bunbury of Kansas City.
Twenty of the players are from Major League Soccer and three from Scandinavian teams on winter break. Players are scheduled to report to the Home Depot Center on Jan. 4. The average age is just more than 23, and veterans will be mixed in later in the spring as the U.S. prepares for the CONCACAF Gold Cup.

description.hltext_display: Guardian mulls appeal over extradition case documents
description.author: PA Media Lawyer
description.content:
The Guardian newspaper is examining ways to appeal a ruling that press and media are not entitled to copies of skeleton arguments, documents or other exhibits placed before a magistrates' court.
The decision came as Lord Justice Sullivan and Mr Justice Silber of the Divisional Court rejected an appeal by the Guardian News and Media yesterday.
GNM had appealed against the refusal of a district judge at City of Westminster Magistrates' Court to allow it to have copies of or access to documents put before the court in extradition proceedings against London-based solicitor Jeffrey Tesler and Wojciech Chodan, a former executive of an American company.
The United States wanted the two men extradited in connection with allegations that they had been involved in bribery of Nigerian officials.
The Divisional Court held yesterday that the District Judge was correct in her decision.
Guardian News and Media said the company was examining the possibility of an appeal.
"We are not sure what the route of appeal might be, but we are definitely examining our options," said a spokeswoman.
The Guardian's first applied for disclosure of a number of documents in the extradition case when District Judge Caroline Tubbs gave judgment in the case of Tesler in March this year.
The documents, which were put before the court and mentioned in oral argument, included skeleton arguments prepared by counsel, affidavits by a US official, and various correspondence.
But District Judge Tubbs declined to order disclosure, saying that she had no inherent jurisdiction to do so.
In addition, nothing was disclosed or discussed in the documents which had not already been dealt with in oral argument in open court, she said.
Guardian News and Media appealed by way of case stated, and applied for judicial review of the District Judge's decision.
Gavin Millar QC, for the newspaper, argued that the principle of open justice required first that in criminal cases, all evidence communicated to the court should be available for inspection by the press if it could show an adequate reason for its production, and second that nothing should be done to discourage or frustrate the publication to a wider public of fair and accurate reports of proceedings.
The court could only depart from the general rule that justice should be administered in public where the nature or circumstances of the particular proceedings were such that the application of the general rule in its entirety would frustrate or render impracticable the administration of justice or would damage some other public interest.

event_or_fact.property: the principle of open justice required first that in criminal cases, all evidence communicated to the court should be available for inspection by the press if it could show an adequate reason for its production, and second that nothing should be done to d
In addition, nothing was disclosed or discussed in the documents which had not already been dealt with in oral argument in open court

description.hltext_display: Carrefour indeniza idosa por escorregão em alface
description.content:
BBC Brasil Supermercado não se pronunciou sobre eventual recurso
Um tribunal francês condenou o grupo Carrefour a pagar uma indenização de 20 mil euros (R$ 44,5 mil) a uma septuagenária que escorregou em uma folha de alface no chão de um supermercado e fraturou a perna. Segundo a imprensa francesa, essa decisão, anunciada na segunda-feira, é algo inédito no país e poderá criar jurisprudência.
Em 2008, uma cliente de um fast-food em Reims que havia escorregado em uma batata frita no chão do restaurante e sofrido rompimento dos ligamentos do joelho não obteve a indenização pleiteada na Justiça. No caso atual, o Tribunal Correcional de Montpellier, no sul da França, estimou que o hipermercado foi responsável pela queda da cliente, já que o piso "escorregadio de maneira anormal" da loja provocou o acidente, ocorrido em 2006.
A idosa, na época com 72 anos, conseguiu provar na Justiça que o chão da seção de frutas e legumes do hipermercado, situado na região de Hérault, no sul da França, estava sujo, repleto de resíduos de comida. A senhora, citada pela imprensa francesa apenas como Josiane, sofreu uma dupla fratura do fêmur e teve de ser operada duas vezes. Ela também precisou fazer fisioterapia durante meses e sofreu uma perda da mobilidade da perna.
"A gravidade dos ferimentos e a reação do supermercado, que se recusou a efetuar uma indenização, nos levou a recorrer à Justiça", disse o advogado da septuagenária, Emmanuel Ludot. "O supermercado tem a obrigação de limpar corretamente o chão da loja e assegurar a segurança da clientela", afirmou. O grupo Carrefour declarou que ainda aguardava receber a cópia da sentença do tribunal antes de se pronunciar sobre um eventual recurso.

description.hltext_display: Speedgirls drop Panthers
description.content: Bessemer's Sarah Ahnen (33) takes a shot as Heather Selin sets a screen on Ewen-Trout Creek's Casey Suomumaki during Tuesday's Porcupine Mountain Conference game at Bessemer. The Speedgirls won 51-29. (Pat Krause/Daily Globe photo)

description.hltext_display: Pine Nuts: Garrison Keillor disowns his grandfather ? Mark Twain
description.author: McAvoy Layne
description.content: INCLINE VILLAGE, Nev. ? In Sunday's New York Times Book Review, Garrison Keillor writes a front page article suggesting that Mark Twain, in his newly minted century-old autobiography, casts a four-pound wooden nickel upon an unsuspecting public. Me thinks Mr. Garrison is suffering from sucking on sour grapes. Of the dozen or so recipients of the Mark Twain Award for American Humor, Tina Fey is one, Garrison Keillor is not. Louder than his criticism of Twain's Volume One, I hear a gnashing of teeth. But then, by Twain's own admission, ?The human race is a self-admiring humbug.?In his article, Keillor reworks a denigration that Adam Gopnik made in the New Yorker, implying Twain had perpetuated a literary Royal Nonesuch on an adoring public. Keillor writes, ?The book turns out to be a wonderful fraud on the order of the Duke and the Dauphin in their Shakespearean romp?? Coincidence? Perhaps. But I suspect Keillor is too well read and too keen on Twain to have missed Gopnik's critique, which consumed the Twain Internet Circle like a Missouri grass fire.So how is it that Keillor has never won the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor, anyway? My guess is that Keillor gets so folksy at times that he wanders onto the sentimentally soft grass of schmaltz. Secondary school teachers have intimated that Keillor doesn't fly in today's classroom. AP English students will give Keillor's maudlin monotone two minutes before begging for SpongeBob.If humor is a tonic, then Twain's Volume One is an elixir. Twain once described William Dean Howell's humor in such a way as to reveal his own: ?His is a humor which flows softly all around, about and over and through the mesh of the page, pervasive, refreshing, health-giving, and makes no more show and no more noise than does the circulation of the blood.?I offer this sample from Volume One??That graceful and competent speaker, Professor Norton, opened the game with a very handsome speech, but it was a good twenty minutes long. And a good ten minutes of it, I think, were devoted to the introduction of Dr. Oliver Wendell Holmes, who hadn't any more need of an introduction than the Milky Way. Then Dr. Holmes recited -as only Dr. Holmes could recite it -?The Last Leaf,? and the house rose as one individual and went mad with worshiping delight. And the house stormed along, and stormed along, and got another poem out of the Doctor as an encore; it stormed again and got a third one -though the storm was not so violent this time as it had been the previous outbreaks. By this time Dr. Holmes had himself lost a part of his mind, and he actually went on reciting poem after poem until silence had taken the place of encores, and he had to do the last encore by himself. He was the loveliest human being in Boston?That's amusing. We've seen hundreds of great comedians in this country, but very few great humorists. The comedian's job is to make us laugh, whereas the humorist's job is merely to show us the good natured side of the truth. The humorist is not looking for a laugh; the humorist is looking for a nod of acknowledgment, perhaps the hint of a smile. Garrison Keillor is a humorist and a gifted one. He is quick to grasp regional humor. Appearing at Lawler Center a few years back he read a letter written home from Reno, ?Son, your mother and I are sorry about your tuition money. We did not know you are not supposed to split your tens.? Garrison Keillor is a pantheon of American humor, and as such, owes more to his grandfather than he knows.As Dick Gregory reminds us, ?Twain was so far ahead of his time that he shouldn't even be talked about on the same day as other people.?The Autobiography of Mark Twain will make an excellent Christmas present. If the reader agrees with Garrison Keillor's opinion of it, well then, he can use it as a capable doorstopper during the summer months.? McAvoy Layne is an Incline Village resident who visits area schools as the ghost of Mark Twain. Learn more at ghostoftwain.com.

event_or_fact.property: Mark Twain, in his newly minted century-old autobiography, casts a four-pound wooden nickel upon an unsuspecting public.

description.hltext_display: Минэкономразвития: предложение по повышению возраста выхода на пенсию неприемлемо для нашего общества
Fight Looms After Texas Gets 4 New US House Seats
description.author: JAY ROOT
description.content:
AUSTIN, Texas -- A surge of Hispanic residents and other population gains have Texas poised to add more congressional clout than any other state, but a partisan fight now looms over exactly where the new seats should go.
Texas is gaining four seats in the U.S. House, twice as many as Florida, the only other state to pick up multiple ones, according to new population figures announced Tuesday by the U.S. Census Bureau. All told, Republican-leaning states will pick up at least a half dozen House seats thanks to the 2010 census, which found the nation's population growing more slowly than in past decades but still shifting to the South and West.
With Texas Republicans using recent elections to fortify their already solid control of the state Legislature, the political process of redrawing the state's congressional map would seem to benefit the GOP, too.
But Democrats say not so fast.
Boyd Richie, chairman of the Texas Democratic Party, said Hispanic and black population growth account for the additional seats, and he vowed to fight for a redistricting plan that takes their numbers into account.
"A legal and fair redistricting process must produce new congressional districts that reflect the Hispanic and African American population growth," Richie said. "Our Democratic numbers may be down, but we are not out. Democrats cannot and will not allow our voices to be silenced in this critical process."
The Census Bureau said the nation's population on April 1 was 308,745,538, up from 281.4 million a decade ago. The growth rate for the past decade was 9.7 percent, the lowest since the Great Depression. The U.S. population grew by 13.2 percent from 1990 to 2000. Michigan was the only state to lose population during the past decade. Nevada, with a 35 percent increase, was the fastest-growing state.
The new numbers are a boon for Republicans, with Texas leading the way among GOP-leaning states that will gain House seats, mostly at the Rust Belt's expense. Following each once-a-decade census, the nation must reapportion the House's 435 districts to make them roughly equal in population, with each state getting at least one seat.
In all, the census figures show a shift affecting 18 states taking effect when the 113th Congress takes office in 2013. The political power follows the high population growth, shifting toward the south and west and away from the industrial Midwest and northeast.
With reapportionment settled, the far more politically divisive process of redistricting is set to begin. In Texas, both major parties were bracing for a showdown over the state's new residents, beginning a fight that is sure to spark court action. But with Republican supermajorities in the Legislature, the temptation to run the table will be strong.
Rep. Pete Gallego, D-Alpine, said if the federal courts don't intervene to compel fairness, Republicans will likely produce a map that gives their party the advantage in three or perhaps even all four of the new seats.
"It is very easy to overreach when you're holding the map and have the pen in your hand," he said.
Despite the party's recent gains in the November legislative elections, Republicans won't have unchecked authority to draw the state's congressional map to benefit themselves.
Civil rights laws require that the interests of minority voters be protected as district boundaries are redrawn, and Texas is one of the states whose redistricting plans require "pre-clearance" by federal authorities under the Voting Rights Act.
Democrats are also counting on an assist from the Obama administration, which could have a significant voice in the pre-clearance process. It is the first time since the Voting Rights Act passed that the Justice Department will be in Democratic hands during the redistricting process.
Hispanic growth doesn't automatically translate into Democratic growth, though. Two heavily Hispanic congressional seats in South Texas flipped to Republicans this year. There also are several new Latino GOP members about to be sworn into legislative seats.
South Texas Rep. Aaron Pena, who recently left the Democrat Party and became a Republican, said Texas Latinos are more conservative than their counterparts in western states such as California and Nevada.
Pena, who sits on the House Redistricting Committee, said his "educated guess" was that Republicans would get three of the four seats.
"The Hispanic community is increasingly up for grabs," Pena said. "It's truly a swing population."
Texas already had the largest Republican delegation in Congress, holding 20 of the state's 32 seats. In the 2010 elections, the party picked up another three seats, two of them in heavily Latino districts in South Texas. With all the new growth, Texas will now have 36 seats and 38 presidential electoral votes.
Federal lawsuits are essentially guaranteed as part of the process, and if the past is any guide, the courts will have a major say in how the lines are finally drawn. In 2001, the Texas Legislature deadlocked on Congressional redistricting, leaving the federal courts to redraw all the districts. In 2006, the U.S. Supreme Court ordered that new lines be drawn in several districts to protect the rights of Hispanic voters in South Texas.
Starting early next year, most state governments will use detailed, computer-generated data on voting patterns to carve neighborhoods in or out of newly drawn House districts, tilting them more to the left or right. Sometimes politicians play it safe, quietly agreeing to protect Republican and Democratic incumbents alike. But sometimes the party in control will gamble and aggressively try to reconfigure the map to dump as many opponents as possible.
The U.S. is still growing quickly relative to other developed nations. The population in France and England each increased roughly 5 percent over the past decade, while in Japan the number is largely unchanged, and Germany's population is declining. China grew at about 6 percent; Canada's growth rate is roughly 10 percent.
The 2010 census results also are used to distribute more than $400 billion in annual federal aid and will change each state's Electoral College votes beginning in the 2012 presidential election.
Apart from the respective four- and two-seat gains in Texas and Florida, Arizona, Georgia, Nevada, South Carolina, Utah and Washington are all picking up one new U.S. House seat. Ohio and New York will lose two House seats each. Losing one House seat are Illinois, Iowa, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.
Each House district represents an electoral vote in the presidential election process, meaning the political map for the 2012 election will tilt somewhat more Republican.

description.hltext_display: Aguilar y Valcárcel destacan su buena sintonía y coinciden en pedir "agua para todos y para siempre"
description.content:
Foto: CARM MA
MADRID, 21 Dic. (EUROPA PRESS) -
La ministra de Medio Ambiente, Rural y Marino, Rosa Aguilar, y el presidente de Murcia, Ramón Luis Varcárcel, han destacado la buena sintonía que ha presidido la primera reunión mantenida entre ambos en la sede del Ministerio, y tras la que han coincidido en pedir "agua para todos y para siempre".
En declaraciones a los medios, tanto el presidente murciano como la ministra han destacado la buena sintonía entre ambos. "Esta es la primera reunión y espero que no la última", ha apostillado el jefe del Ejecutivo murciano.
Valcárcel ha señalado sentirse en "alerta permanente" por el debate del reparto del agua de las cuentas hidrográficas españolas, aunque ha reiterado que se trata de un asunto del Gobierno de José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero y no de las comunidades autónomas.
En este sentido, el presidente murciano ha criticado el trasvase del Tajo porque "no tiene ningún sentido" y ha solicitado la "necesidad imperiosa" de un pacto nacional sobre el agua.
Valcárcel ha criticado la postura en temas hidrográficos del presidente de Castilla-La Mancha, José María Barreda, ya que él "no negará jamás el derecho al agua como ha hecho Barreda con los murcianos". "Nosotros vemos a Castilla-La Mancha como una región hermana, en nada que necesite agua se la vamos a dar y no la vamos a reclamar", ha destacado.
Asimismo, ha pedido que no primen los "caprichos" políticos por encima de los intereses generales en temas tan primordiales como la necesidad del agua en algunas comunidades.
La ministra ha reiterado la necesidad de responder desde el diálogo con las comunidades para entablar un pacto nacional por el agua. "Este pacto tiene que garantizar agua de calidad", ha añadido.
ACUERDOS CON MARRUECOS
Sobre el acuerdo firmado por la Unión Europea con Marruecos para la venta de tomates, Valcárcel ha afirmado que la "invasión" del mercado marroquí puede producir una bajada de precios. "La ministra ha prometido medidas de control reales y efectivas para revisar que se cumplan los pactos", ha añadido.
Aguilar ha prometido "transparencia" y "claridad total" en este asunto, al tiempo que ha señalado que el presidente murciano tiene que estar "tranquilo" porque buscará herramientas para "generar mejores condiciones de trabajo".
Además, ha respaldado al sector del tomate en España y ha añadido estar "vigilante" para que los acuerdos entre la UE y Marruecos se cumplan y no afecten a los trabajadores de nuestro país.

description.hltext_display: Japan forecasts GDP growth to slow in 2011
description.content:
The pace of Japan's economic growth will halve in fiscal 2011 from this year as a stimulus-driven shopping rush eases and exports fall on a strong yen and softer demand, the government said Wednesday.
In its outlook report, the Cabinet Office also said consumer prices will stop falling but will not rise, dealing a blow to Prime Minister Naoto Kan's stated goal of ending deflation in the year.
Recent year-on-year falls in the consumer price index will halt in the middle of next year, the Cabinet Office said, but suggested this would not represent the defeat of chronic deflation in the economy.
Growth is forecast to slow to a real 1.5 percent from 3.1 percent in this year, the government said in its outlook report.
Government stimulus measures helped boost domestic production and consumption in the current year, including subsidy programmes for purchases of environmentally friendly vehicles and appliances.
Japan's economy grew 4.5 percent in the July-September quarter, amplified by a rush by car buyers to use expiring subsidies and smokers who stocked up on cigarettes ahead of a tax hike during the period.
The hottest summer on record also drove sales of items such as air conditioners, helping spur growth in the quarter. Private consumption accounts for around 60 percent of gross domestic product.
However, analysts warn of a contraction in the fourth calendar quarter as the removal of such one-off factors highlights Japan's exposure to a weakening export picture and slow domestic demand.
Recent data has shown a slump in industrial output, especially among carmakers, as well as weakening consumer confidence as such incentive programmes come to an end.
The economy remains mired in crippling deflation, as falling prices prompt consumers to hold off on purchase decisions in the expectation of further price drops, clouding future corporate investment.
Japan's export growth accelerated for the first time in nine months in November, data showed Wednesday, but the reading of a 9.1 percent increase fell short of expectations amid fears of a looming economic slowdown.
"The pick-up in the year-on-year growth rate of exports in November may look encouraging but exports are heading for a big quarterly fall," noted research consultancy Capital Economics.
Analysts said the Japanese economy remains locked in a trend of shrinking exports due to a stronger yen, which makes Japanese products more expensive in overseas markets, and expectations that overseas demand will weaken.
On Tuesday the Bank of Japan held its key rate at between zero and 0.1 percent after a two-day meeting, warning that a fragile recovery from deep recession was "pausing".
The central bank in October forecast that the country's economy would expand 2.1 percent in the fiscal year ending in April, and 1.8 percent in 2011.
Japan last month passed an extra budget worth 58 billion dollars to cover a new stimulus package aimed at averting the threat of a "double-dip" recession.
Kan's second stimulus package since he came to power is designed to ease concerns over deflation and a strong yen, and includes job programmes, welfare spending and assistance for small businesses.
Kan took office in June promising to slash spending and work towards cutting the country's massive public debt, at nearly 200 percent of gross domestic product.
But the state of Japan's economy has complicated his ambitions.
Consumer spending growth is expected to slow next year to 0.6 percent from 1.5 percent this year.
However, the government forecast unemployment to continue to slowly improve, with the jobless rate expected to fall in the fiscal year starting April to 4.7 percent from 5.0 percent currently.

description.hltext_display: Foodies fight with film school for space in LA
description.content:
LOS ANGELES — Fans of the Hollywood Farmers Market are hoping for a permanent resolution to the permitting dispute that's been threatening the weekly produce bazaar.
Organizers have until mid-April to reach an accommodation with the adjacent film school that has been refusing to sign off on the market's permit.
Los Angeles Film School officials say the market blocks an entryway into one of the school's parking lots for several hours each Sunday.
Organizers say shifting the stalls that block the lot to another part of the market would result in the loss of many vendors. They say that could cut back on revenue they use to support smaller markets in the city's poor neighborhoods.

description.hltext_display: Continúan las precipitaciones en toda Andalucía salvo en Almería
description.content:
Los cielos estarán hoy muy nubosos, con precipitaciones débiles a moderadas, que pueden se localmente fuertes y persistentes y ocasionalmente acompañadas de tormentas salvo en Almería, según el pronóstico de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET).
Las temperaturas experimentarán un ligero a moderado descenso, más acusado en el oeste de la comunidad.
Los vientos soplarán del suroeste moderados en general y fuertes en el litoral atlántico, girando por la tarde a oeste y aumentando a fuertes en el litoral mediterráneo, con rachas de muy fuertes hasta mediodía en el oeste.

description.hltext_display: Рафаэль Надаль: «Теперь Федерер нравится мне чуть меньше»
description.content:
Первая ракетка мира испанец , уступивший швейцарцу в первом из 6:4, 3:6, 3:6, объяснил, что все дело не в теннисе. Первая ракетка мира испанец , уступивший швейцарцу в первом из 6:4, 3:6, 3:6, объяснил, что все дело не в теннисе. «Мы оба понимаем, что нам очень повезло в жизни, у нас есть все, о чем можно мечтать, и меньшее, что мы можем сделать, – это помочь людям, которые живут в трудных условиях.
Мы смотрим в будущее. Когда ты можешь отправить 1 500 детей в школу, это прекрасно, но это еще не все: нужно еще решить, как они будут добираться до школы, чем они будут там обедать, если ли в школе туалеты... Обо все этом мы заботимся», – приводит слова Надаля Eurosport.
Также в экспресс-интервью после матча испанец пошутил, что после двух подряд поражений от Федерера он симпатизирует швейцарцу «чуть меньше». Добавим, ответный матч состоится сегодня в Мадриде и будет в прямом эфире показал по Евроспорту. Начало трансляции – 20:55 по Москве. Постоянный адрес страницы:
